atg.commerce.pricing.result
Class DetailedItemPrice

java.lang.Object
  atg.commerce.pricing.result.DetailedItemPrice

public class DetailedItemPrice
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a breakdown of a CommerceItem's price. Different quantities of a single CommerceItem may be priced differently, depending on how each qualifies for different promotions.

Example:

Let's say there exists a CommerceItem whose sku is a red pair of shorts and whose quantity is 5. This is equivalent to saying that someone has put 5 pairs of red shorts in their virtual shopping cart. Let's also say that a user has a promotion good for 10 percent off up to 3 pairs of shorts. This is where DetailedItemPriceInfo comes in. A single ItemPriceInfo can't capture all of the information needed. The ItemPriceInfo will have two DetailedItemPriceInfo entries in its currentPriceDetails List:

  • A DetailedItemPriceInfo whose quantity is 3 and whose price reflects the price of the 3 items that got the discount
  • A DetailedItemPriceInfo whose quantity is 2 and whose price reflects the price of the 2 items that did not receive the discount.
Properties:
  • amount, the cost of this item
  • discounted, boolean indicating if the item was discounted
  • quantity represents the number of items for which this is a detailed price. Must be at least 1.
  • tax the amount of tax paid for this item
  • range represents the range of items for which this is a detailed price. The size of the range must equals quantity
  • quantityAsQualifier is used to remember how many of this quantity have been used as a qualifier for some rule. No single item can be used as a qualifier for more than one rule.
  • detailedUnitPrice is the price of a single one of the items that this quantity represents collectively. It's always calculated by dividing the amount by the quantity.
  • adjustments, an array of the discounts applied to the item
A DetailedItemPrice represents the way at least a quantity of 1 was priced. In DCS, this object appears in the List currentPriceDetails in the ItemPriceInfo class.

See Also:
ItemPrice
